Models¶

Card¶

Represents a Pokemon Trading Card Game card.

This model stores essential information about individual Pokemon cards including their name, type, and which set they belong to. It maintains relationships with CardType and CardSet models, as well as connecting to decks through DeckCards.

models.Card.id¶

Primary key for the card

Type:

int

models.Card.name¶

Name of the card

Type:

str

models.Card.cardtype_id¶

Foreign key reference to the card type

Type:

int

models.Card.cardset_id¶

Foreign key reference to the set

Type:

int

models.Card.card_number¶

Number of the card within its set

Type:

str

models.Card.cardtype¶

Relationship to the card type

Type:

relationship

models.Card.cardset¶

Relationship to the parent set

Type:

relationship

models.Card.deck_cards¶

Relationship to associated decks

Type:

relationship

Type:

DeckCard¶

Represents the association between decks and cards, tracking card quantities in decks.

This model manages the many-to-many relationship between Deck and Card models, allowing cards to be included in multiple decks with specific quantities.

models.DeckCard.id¶

Primary key

Type:

int

models.DeckCard.deck_id¶

Foreign key to the deck containing the card

Type:

int

models.DeckCard.card_id¶

Foreign key to the card being included

Type:

int

models.DeckCard.quantity¶

Number of copies of this card in the deck

Type:

int

Relationships:

deck: Reference to the parent Deck card: Reference to the associated Card

Battlelog¶

Battlelog model for managing Pokemon TCG battle logs

class models.battlelog.Battlelog(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a battle log entry in the database.

This model stores statistics and outcomes from individual Pokemon TCG matches, tracking metrics like card usage, synergies, and game duration.

id¶

Primary key identifier for the battle log

Type:

int

deck_id¶

Foreign key linking to the deck used in battle

Type:

int

win_loss¶

True for win, False for loss

Type:

bool

total_turns¶

Number of turns the battle lasted

Type:

int

most_used_cards¶

Array of frequently played cards during the match

Type:

JSON

key_synergy_cards¶

Array of cards that created effective combinations

Type:

JSON

deck¶

Relationship to associated Deck model

Type:

relationship

query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Format¶

Format module for managing Pokemon TCG game formats and their rules.

This module defines the Format model, which represents different play formats like Standard, Expanded, and Unlimited. Each format has specific rules about which card sets are legal for play.

class models.format.Format(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a Pokémon Trading Card Game format.

A format defines which cards are legal for tournament play based on release dates and set legality. Examples include:

  • Standard: Newest sets only.

  • Expanded: Black & White forward.

  • Unlimited: All cards are legal.

id¶

Unique identifier for the format.

Type:

int

name¶

Name of the format, must be unique (e.g., “Standard”).

Type:

str

description¶

Detailed rules and set restrictions for the format.

Type:

str

start_date¶
to_dict()[source]¶

Convert Format object to dictionary representation.

Returns:

Format data in dictionary format

Return type:

dict
